page.title: 11Farms in Trimley
page.content: In the past most of the houses in Trimey were along the Street,or High Road,and most of the farms were isolated. Many of the farmsteads are very old and some are mentioned as manors in the Domesday Book. Searsons Farm is the largest holding, covering about 1000 acres,not all in our block, It has modern sheds and a large grain drier. Grimston Hall,once the home of Thomas Cavendish,the second Englishman to sail round the world,is still a working farm of 478 acres. Alston Hall,another Domesday manor, is now farmed from Goslings Farm,just outside our block. Great Street Farm is on the High Road,next to the Welcome Hall.It has 503 acres of land.
